text.section: A person is guilty of abandonment of a minor when, as a parent, guardian or other person legally charged with the care or custody of a minor, he deserts the minor in any place under circumstances endangering his life or health and with intent to abandon him.
Abandonment of a minor is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 260, effective January 1, 1975.
